intro: Lipozygis pentaphylla, commonly known as the five-leafed lipozygis, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories where it can thrive without direct sunlight. Its botanical features include five leaves arranged in a whorl, giving it its common name, and small white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
